segment.source: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration
segment.target: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration

segment.source: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration
segment.target: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration

segment.source: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration
segment.target: Validating the MBAM 2.5 Server Feature Configuration

segment.source: When you finish the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Server feature deployment, we recommend that you validate the deployment to ensure that all features have been successfully configured.
segment.target: When you finish the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Server feature deployment, we recommend that you validate the deployment to ensure that all features have been successfully configured.

segment.source: Use the procedure that matches the topology (Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration) that you deployed.
segment.target: Use the procedure that matches the topology (Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration) that you deployed.

segment.source: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with the Stand-alone topology
segment.target: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with the Stand-alone topology

segment.source: Use the following steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment with the Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: Use the following steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment with the Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: To validate a Stand-alone MBAM Server deployment
segment.target: To validate a Stand-alone MBAM Server deployment

segment.source: On each server where an MBAM feature is deployed, click Control PanelProgramsPrograms and Features.
segment.target: On each server where an MBAM feature is deployed, click Control PanelProgramsPrograms and Features.

segment.source: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.
segment.target: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To do the validation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To do the validation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: On the server where the Recovery Database is configured, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is configured.
segment.target: On the server where the Recovery Database is configured, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is configured.

segment.source: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status Database is configured.
segment.target: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status Database is configured.

segment.source: On the server where the Reports feature is configured, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the "Home" of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.
segment.target: On the server where the Reports feature is configured, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the "Home" of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.

segment.source: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:
segment.target: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMReportsServerName:port/Reports.aspx
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMReportsServerName:port/Reports.aspx

segment.source: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances that you specified during setup.
segment.target: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances that you specified during setup.

segment.source: Confirm that a reports folder named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring contains a data source called MaltaDataSource as well as the language folders.
segment.target: Confirm that a reports folder named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring contains a data source called MaltaDataSource as well as the language folders.

segment.source: The data source contains folders with names that represent languages (for example, en-us).
segment.target: The data source contains folders with names that represent languages (for example, en-us).

segment.source: The reports are in the language folders.
segment.target: The reports are in the language folders.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following: http(s)://MBAMReportsServerName:port/ReportsSSRSInstanceName
segment.target: If SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following: http(s)://MBAMReportsServerName:port/ReportsSSRSInstanceName

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.
segment.target: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.

segment.source: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as Help Desk) and select a report, the following message appears: "Only Secure Content is Displayed."
segment.target: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as Help Desk) and select a report, the following message appears: "Only Secure Content is Displayed."

segment.source: To show the report, click Show All Content.
segment.target: To show the report, click Show All Content.

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring Website feature is configured, run Server Manager, browse to Roles, and then select Web Server (IIS)Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring Website feature is configured, run Server Manager, browse to Roles, and then select Web Server (IIS)Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.

segment.source: In Connections, browse to computer name and select SitesMicrosoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: In Connections, browse to computer name and select SitesMicrosoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: Verify that the following are listed:
segment.target: Verify that the following are listed:

segment.source: MBAMAdministrationService
segment.target: MBAMAdministrationService

segment.source: MBAMComplianceStatusService
segment.target: MBAMComplianceStatusService

segment.source: MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService
segment.target: MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal are configured, open a web browser with administrative credentials.
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal are configured, open a web browser with administrative credentials.

segment.source: Browse to the following websites to verify that they load successfully:
segment.target: Browse to the following websites to verify that they load successfully:

segment.source: https(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/HelpDesk/ - confirm each of the links for navigation and reports
segment.target: https(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/HelpDesk/ - confirm each of the links for navigation and reports

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/SelfService/
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/SelfService/

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is assumed that you configured the server features on the default port without network encryption.
segment.target: It is assumed that you configured the server features on the default port without network encryption.

segment.source: If you configured the server features on a different port or virtual directory, change the URLs to include the appropriate port, for example:
segment.target: If you configured the server features on a different port or virtual directory, change the URLs to include the appropriate port, for example:

segment.source: http(s)://host name:port/HelpDesk/
segment.target: http(s)://host name:port/HelpDesk/

segment.source: http(s)://host name:portvirtualdirectory
segment.target: http(s)://host name:portvirtualdirectory

segment.source: If the server features were configured with network encryption, change http:// to https://.
segment.target: If the server features were configured with network encryption, change http:// to https://.

segment.source: Browse to the following web services to verify that they load successfully.
segment.target: Browse to the following web services to verify that they load successfully.

segment.source: A page opens to indicate that the service is running, but the page does not display any metadata.
segment.target: A page opens to indicate that the service is running, but the page does not display any metadata.

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMUserSupportService/UserSupportService.svc
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMUserSupportService/UserSupportService.svc

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc

segment.source: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with the Configuration Manager Integration topology
segment.target: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with the Configuration Manager Integration topology

segment.source: Use the following steps to validate your MBAM deployment with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: Use the following steps to validate your MBAM deployment with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: Complete the validation steps that match the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.
segment.target: Complete the validation steps that match the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.

segment.source: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager
segment.target: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager

segment.source: Use these steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment when you are using MBAM with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Use these steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment when you are using MBAM with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: To validate a Configuration Manager Integration MBAM Server deployment – System Center 2012 Configuration Manager
segment.target: To validate a Configuration Manager Integration MBAM Server deployment – System Center 2012 Configuration Manager

segment.source: On the server where System Center 2012 Configuration Manager is deployed, open Programs and Features in Control Panel, and verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears.
segment.target: On the server where System Center 2012 Configuration Manager is deployed, open Programs and Features in Control Panel, and verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To validate the configuration, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To validate the configuration, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Device Collections, and confirm that a new collection called MBAM Supported Computers is displayed.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Device Collections, and confirm that a new collection called MBAM Supported Computers is displayed.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Monitoring workspace ReportingReportsMBAM.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Monitoring workspace ReportingReportsMBAM.

segment.source: Verify that the MBAM folder contains subfolders, with names that represent different languages, and that the following reports are listed in each language subfolder:
segment.target: Verify that the MBAM folder contains subfolders, with names that represent different languages, and that the following reports are listed in each language subfolder:

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Compliance SettingsConfiguration Baselines, and confirm that the configuration baseline BitLocker Protection is listed.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Compliance SettingsConfiguration Baselines, and confirm that the configuration baseline BitLocker Protection is listed.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Compliance SettingsConfiguration Items, and confirm that the following new configuration items are displayed:
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click the Assets and Compliance workspace Compliance SettingsConfiguration Items, and confirm that the following new configuration items are displayed:

segment.source: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection

segment.source: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection

segment.source: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with Configuration Manager 2007
segment.target: Validating the MBAM Server deployment with Configuration Manager 2007

segment.source: Use these steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment when you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: Use these steps to validate your MBAM Server deployment when you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: To validate a Configuration Manager Integration MBAM Server deployment – Configuration Manager 2007
segment.target: To validate a Configuration Manager Integration MBAM Server deployment – Configuration Manager 2007

segment.source: On the server where Configuration Manager 2007 is deployed, open Programs and Features on Control Panel , and verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears.
segment.target: On the server where Configuration Manager 2007 is deployed, open Programs and Features on Control Panel , and verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To validate the configuration, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To validate the configuration, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click Site Database SiteCodeServerName, SiteName), Computer Management, and confirm that a new collection called MBAM Supported Computers is displayed.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click Site Database SiteCodeServerName, SiteName), Computer Management, and confirm that a new collection called MBAM Supported Computers is displayed.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click ReportingReporting ServicesServerNameReport FoldersMBAM.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click ReportingReporting ServicesServerNameReport FoldersMBAM.

segment.source: Verify that the MBAM folder contains subfolders, with names that represent different languages, and that the following reports are listed in each language subfolder:
segment.target: Verify that the MBAM folder contains subfolders, with names that represent different languages, and that the following reports are listed in each language subfolder:

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click Desired Configuration ManagementConfiguration Baselines, and confirm that the configuration baseline BitLocker Protection is listed.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click Desired Configuration ManagementConfiguration Baselines, and confirm that the configuration baseline BitLocker Protection is listed.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, click Desired Configuration ManagementConfiguration Items, and confirm that the following new configuration items are displayed:
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, click Desired Configuration ManagementConfiguration Items, and confirm that the following new configuration items are displayed:

segment.source: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection
